title: *Cough, what do I do?
body:
My friend here wants to improve. He wants some tips.

Nothing I have suggested sticks. He just dies and dies and dies. Look at his match history. If he breaches 1.0 KDA, then he's done relatively well.

What do I do with a person like this who is so adamant that he play ranked? I feel people like my friend just take away from the game.

Any tips I can give him? Or should we all just add him to our dodge list? I mean, his deaths... they're obscene.

And believe me, he's not inting. He just doesn't know how to not die.

replies.body:
Clearly a bronze level player playing in gold level games.

Since that account has been gold or higher for 4 seasons, looks to be a bought account, or you've given him a smurf.

Your friend will eventually just keep losing until he lands where he belongs. Looking at the cs average and kda, someone in high bronze is likely.

Your friend clearly has no idea how to play. tell them to rank up their own account and learn the game rather than shortcut it.
Agreed. Or get them to **WIN** 250 normal games before attempting ranked. Then they will be ready.

That's stupid. Playing normals is a waste of time because everyone messes around. You only improve in ranked where winning means something.
Not true, for newbies, 250 wins in normals will introduce them to carrying trolls and afkers, as well as the basics of how to win the game.
How is that possible, he must be trolling. His damage stats are way too low and his deaths 0.0
He seem like he dont belong at that rank. Did he get his hand on a "handed down account"? Or he bought it off some one?

You know... I remember when I was like your friend. My silver/gold friends brought me in and I flopped. I went off on my own and learned on my own and I am roughly at a silver-gold level now. If your friend wants to do ranked then make a smurf to play with him. If you're worried about your main's elo then smurf with him. You don't lose elo and he gets someone to play with. At that point it's just having fun with him and who cares if he has a rough time. He will figure it out or if he doesn't then show him guides from Probuilds etc.
